skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: CesarAugustusGroB

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation in a single SKILL.md file. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reading was detected. The content is purely instructional guidance for creating AI skills.

content.user_title: Create effective AI skills with proven design patterns
content.value_statement: Building AI skills requires careful planning and structure. This guide provides proven patterns for creating skills that extend Claude's capabilities effectively while managing context efficiently.
actual_capabilities: Explains when to use scripts vs references vs assets
limitations: Requires manual implementation of skill contents
Limited to guidance and best practices

use_cases.title: Design custom AI skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills for specific domains or workflows that extend Claude's capabilities beyond general knowledge.

use_cases.title: Standardize skill development
use_cases.description: Establish consistent patterns for creating skills that integrate with company-specific systems and processes.

use_cases.title: Publish high-quality skills
use_cases.description: Follow proven design patterns to create skills that are efficient, well-structured, and user-friendly.

prompt_templates.title: Basic skill creation
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new skill from scratch
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill for [specific task]. Can you guide me through the skill creation process step by step?

prompt_templates.title: Skill structure optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a skill that [current functionality]. How can I optimize its structure using progressive disclosure principles?

prompt_templates.title: Resource organization
prompt_templates.scenario: Deciding what to include in a skill
prompt_templates.prompt: For a skill that [skill purpose], should I use scripts, references, or assets? What's the best organization approach?

prompt_templates.title: Context management
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill documentation is getting very long. How can I split it effectively while maintaining discoverability?

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill for processing PDF documents
output: Step 1: Understanding - Ask about specific PDF tasks (merge, split, extract text, etc.)
Step 2: Planning - Identify need for scripts/pdf_processor.py and references/pdf_library_docs.md
Step 4: Edit - Create Python script for PDF operations, add documentation to references/
Step 5: Package - Validate and create pdf-processor.skill file for distribution

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines to minimize context usage
Use progressive disclosure - only load information when needed
Include clear trigger phrases in the description field
Test all scripts before packaging the skill
anti_patterns: Don't duplicate information between SKILL.md and reference files
Avoid creating auxiliary documentation files (README, INSTALL guides)
Don't include unnecessary context about the skill creation process
Never exceed context window limits with overly verbose instructions

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with all Claude versions?
faq.answer: Yes, the design principles work across all Claude implementations including Claude Code and Codex.

faq.question: What's the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md should stay under 500 lines. Reference files can be larger but should include tables of contents for navigation.

faq.question: Can I include executable code in my skills?
faq.answer: Yes, scripts can be included in the scripts/ directory and will be executed when needed without loading into context.

faq.question: How do I ensure my skill triggers correctly?
faq.answer: Write clear, comprehensive descriptions in the YAML frontmatter that include both what the skill does and when to use it.

faq.question: What if my skill needs multiple frameworks?
faq.answer: Organize by framework in separate reference files and link to them from SKILL.md based on user selection.

faq.question: How do I handle large documentation sets?
faq.answer: Split into focused reference files by domain or topic, and include grep patterns in SKILL.md for quick searching.
